docs.lead_paragraph: Ira C. Magaziner, the chief executive of the Clinton Health Access Initiative, has long alienated co-workers, but a recent performance review reveals board members are also unhappy with him.

headline.main: Reviews Reveal Divisions Within the Clinton Health Initiative, Starting at the Top
headline.print_headline: Reviews Reveal Divisions Within the Clinton Health Initiative, Starting at the Top

docs.abstract: Two performance reviews coming from Clinton Foundation concerning Ira C Magaziner, chief executive of foundation's health initiative, offer window into politics and tensions within organization, and in particular role Chelsea Clinton plays as board member.
docs.snippet: Ira C. Magaziner, the chief executive of the Clinton Health Access Initiative, has long alienated co-workers, but a recent performance review reveals board members are also unhappy with him.

docs.lead_paragraph: In January, a staff of 50 or more full-time employees will trigger the law’s employer mandate, which has employers weighing the costs of expansion.

headline.main: Health Care Law Forces Businesses to Consider Growth’s Costs
headline.print_headline: Health Care Law Leads Business Owners to Rethink Plans for Growth

docs.abstract: Affordable Care Act, which starting in 2016 requires businesses with 50 or more full-time employees to offer health insurance, has some small businesses rethinking plans for growth; some owners say they cannot afford to cross threshold.
docs.snippet: In January, a staff of 50 or more full-time employees will trigger the law’s employer mandate, which has employers weighing the costs of expansion.

docs.lead_paragraph: Prices fluctuate sharply on the federal health insurance marketplace, driving many cost-conscious consumers to switch coverage every year to avoid higher premiums.

headline.main: Shopping for Health Insurance Is New Seasonal Stress for Many
headline.print_headline: Now, Finding a Health Plan Is Annual Rite for Shoppers

docs.abstract: Beginning of open enrollment for health insurance plans for 2016 in new markets created by Affordable Care Act finds many Americans switching their plans again; while consumers say they appreciate ability to choose their plans, many complain about necessity of switching due to wild price swings on market, which can often mean finding new doctors and hospitals; some experts have expressed concerns about detrimental effects on quality of care due to such frequent switching.
docs.snippet: Prices fluctuate sharply on the federal health insurance marketplace, driving many cost-conscious consumers to switch coverage every year to avoid higher premiums.
